premises: The river is in flood or the dam is opened but not both at the same time
The river is not in flood
conclusions: If the dam is not opened, then the river is in flood
incorrect conclusions: If the river is in flood, then the dam is opened
If the dam is opened, then the river is in flood

premises: The mountain is snowy or the valley is green but not both at the same time
conclusions: If the valley is not green, then the mountain is snowy
incorrect conclusions: If the mountain is snowy, then the valley is green
If the valley is green, then the mountain is snowy

premises: The coastline is eroding or the beach is widening but not both at the same time
